entries.meaning: (Judaism) Food products made from leavened grain flour, which may not be consumed on Passover in Judaism.
examples: The eating of chametz (leavened products) is explicitly prohibited on Passover (Exod. 12:19–20; 13:3), for the Israelites “took their dough before it was leavened” (Exod. 12:34) and left Egypt in great haste.
